titleproper.value:
Guide to the Papers of Aaron Vanderbilt
                    <lb/>
                    <date calendar="gregorian" era="ce">1835-1979 </date>
                    <date calendar="gregorian" era="ce">(bulk 1863-1913) </date>
                    <lb/>
                    <num></num>
                    <num>MS 654</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Jan Hilley

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2011-11-04T15:25-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Correspondence, military orders, drawings, maps, battle accounts, reports, certificates, clippings, illustrations, receipts and ephemera of Aaron Vanderbilt, businessman and naval veteran of the Civil War. Much of the material is contained in a large scrapbook. A transcript of the scrapbook's contents is available.

p.value: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)
This collection should be cited as the Aaron Vanderbilt Papers, The New-York Historical Society.
Further information may be found in The National Cyclopedia of American Biography. New York: James T. White & Company, 1896. Volume 6, Pages 213-214.
Some of the collection's highlights include:
